review: For the money I really like the Fire TV Stick. If you have Prime and no other easy means of getting the content get this stick, it will make you use the subscription more. The interface is easy to navigate, I can give the remote to anyone and they figure it out within moments.Two gripes that prevented a 5 star rating. One, when streaming HD video the video hiccups ever so slightly every few seconds. My internet connection (40mb/s down and measured peak at 56mb/s) is more than adequate to stream HD. Chromecast did this initially too and was resolved with subsequent software updates.Gripe two, I cannot for the life of me seem to get surround sound out of this device. My receiver is a bit older and does not have HDMI ports on it so it is plugged directly in to my TV which does support 5.1 surround output through optical to the receiver when it is selected in the menu, but the TV does not recognize that it has a surround source plugged in to it.For the time being I use this for casual TV watching in standard definition, but if I'm watching a movie it goes through my PS3 for smoother picture and surround sound.
